Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Extracting title attribute and linktext of an HTML-anchor
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=112974261; y=Rlp96xO8H6QaW9-3tYxZvbsyDzc1f7lEbyKgMpVETsUS3Xd8_w

--0-414376350-1203539552=:19681
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

If your just going to read attributes found on links, then I would recommend regular expressions. Since regexp works with the ReplayCharSequence implemented by Heritrix without adding memory overhead.

To grab the entire link

"(?is)(<a\s.*?>.{0,200}</a>)"

That will give you the entire link, but limit the length to 200 characters in the link text. This will help aborting <a> tags that don't have a closing </a>

You can then use regular expressions to extra the attributes you want.

for the title, example; title="Hello World"

"(?is)\b(title)[\s\t\r\n]?=[\s\t\r\n]?\".*?{0,200}\""

You have to be careful with regular expressions. They can get confused by inline JavaScript.

I think the above works, but I haven't tested it.
